meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Senate Votes to Renew Broad Antiterrorism Law The Senate overwhelmingly passed legislation renewing the sweeping antiterror law known as the USA Patriot Act, ending a months-long impasse on Capitol Hill and virtually guaranteeing that the measure will go to President Bush to be signed. The vote was 89 to 10.
PAGE A14
Senate Rejects Ethics Office Senators backed away from expansive changes in lobbying law, overwhelmingly rejecting a proposal to create an independent office to investigate ethics abuses in Congress.
PAGE A19

Art for Art's Sake The 2006 Whitney Biennial is long on collaboration: several shows under one roof, including works by Urs Fischer, below. It is also very much an insider's affair. A review by Michael Kimmelman.
WEEKEND, PAGE E31
Shiites Reclaim a Mosque The mosque was built by Shiites, but given to Sunni worshipers under Saddam Hussein. Last week the Shiite militia arrived, and now it's named for a Shiite saint.
PAGE A12
Wal-Mart, Grocery Giant Wal-Mart has become the largest grocer in the nation and with that size, it has growing leverage in the way products on its shelves are developed.
BUSINESS DAY, PAGE C1
Fighting Malnutrition Early A World Bank report says the problem of malnutrition for 100 million children must be addressed before the age 2.
PAGE A6

Senate Votes to Renew Broad Antiterrorism Law The Senate overwhelmingly passed legislation renewing the sweeping antiterror law known as the USA Patriot Act, ending a months-long impasse on Capitol Hill and virtually guaranteeing that the measure will go to President Bush to be signed. The vote was 89 to 10.
